timeline.bodyText:
It looks like this will fill my disk with uber jars as I'm using the runner!  Is it possible to clean them up?  (At least during the validateRunner tests... I had about 180 uuid.zip files of 165MB each, and about half of them were suspiciously 0 bytes:
....
-rw-rw-r--. 1 rskraba rskraba    0 May 20 11:41 /tmp/c16485fb-9cf0-41e8-bdeb-53ba6cf0fc15.zip
-rw-rw-r--. 1 rskraba rskraba 165M May 20 11:26 /tmp/c4d8612b-0dc0-431a-9b70-0f1537b7cba4.zip
-rw-rw-r--. 1 rskraba rskraba 165M May 20 11:26 /tmp/c53e3b3a-51bd-470f-bd56-2c195decc25f.zip
-rw-rw-r--. 1 rskraba rskraba    0 May 20 11:41 /tmp/c543b15d-94c8-4629-802d-a20f5846eddb.zip
....
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

replies.bodyText: This is definitely important to fix/clean to not have issues in the CI who already has issues with uncleaned files. Nice catch @RyanSkraba I run this and I did not notice it.
replies.author: iemejia

replies.bodyText:
@RyanSkraba Thank you for reviewing the code, It is good to get another set of eyes to notice mistakes that one makes.
A single zip file is being created for each test since Twister2 treats each test as a new job, the zip file contains the dependency files that are needed by the run. I will look into a way to delete the zip files created by tests that have completed so it does not fill up the disk space.
replies.author: pulasthi

replies.bodyText: I found a solution with forkEvery, I set the temp files created to delete on exit and since the JVM changes for every test class the old temp files will get deleted automatically.
replies.author: pulasthi

timeline.bodyText:
Some of these options seem unused by the runner (unless I'm mistaken...) : applicationName, serializers
Are they meant to be here?
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

replies.bodyText: I initially added them for completeness, but ended up not using some of them. removed the unused options since they can be added if needed later.
replies.author: pulasthi

timeline.bodyText:
OK, as far as I remember, all of the PipelineOption annotations are supposed to go on the getXxx or isXxx methods, not on the setXxx methods...
I thought this was a rule and it's true for all runners but Gearpump and Apex... I would follow the example of Spark/Flink!
Also, for readability: for options, use getXxx before setXxx consistently (or vice versa!)
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

replies.bodyText: Was not aware of that convention, thanks for pointing that out. reformatted according this rule
replies.author: pulasthi

timeline.bodyText:
Haha, this seems like it would be a lie most of the time!
For methods that have fake results like this, I'd put a TODO (at the minimum).
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

replies.bodyText: Those operations are not supported currently, I missed to mark them as such. Fixed them
replies.author: pulasthi

timeline.bodyText: Raw types!  It looks like you're a bit inconsistent with annotating the raw types TSet, TLink and their subclasses with <?>!  I'd strongly prefer to see these filled in consistently.
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

replies.bodyText: I might have to take a little time on this and make sure i get the type information correct. Would it be OK to create improvement issue for this for now, so i can get back to it later after the code is merged?
replies.author: pulasthi

replies.bodyText: Of course!  Objectively, this is only a preference, I'm OK for leaving it for a subsequent improvement/cleanup.
replies.author: RyanSkraba

timeline.bodyText: Consider making this protected to ensure that getFilesToStage() is correctly set via fromOptions
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

timeline.bodyText: Sorry -- is this correct?  Reading this, it looks like if the Twister2 job is RUNNING, the pipeline fails!  Likewise with the test code below.
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

replies.bodyText: This is something that needs to be fixed form the Twister2 side first, currently the submit method returns once the job is complete, and if it returns with the state as "RUNNING" it means that the job terminated and did not complete. This can be fixed once the issue is fixed on the Twister2 side. I hope keeping it as is for now is OK for now.
replies.author: pulasthi

timeline.bodyText: Is this file a mistake?  There's already Twister2StreamingTranslationContext so it could lead to confusion with the similar name.
timeline.author: RyanSkraba

timeline.message: adding twister2 runner with support for batch piplines

timeline.bodyText: Why is this Legacy? Because it is not portable?
timeline.author: iemejia

replies.bodyText: Yes, that was the intention of using the legacy part, I can rename it if needed? what do you think would be the best approach?
replies.author: pulasthi

replies.bodyText: I think Legacy has subtle connotations e.g. being old and 'battle tested' but also difficult to upgrade which in this case do not apply, maybe we can call it classic just to be consistent with the terminology we use now to refer to the non-portable Spark/Flink runners e.g. Twister2ClassicRunner or just let rename it Twister2Runner and call a future portable based runner Twister2PortableRunner. So up to you to decide which of the two you prefer.
replies.author: iemejia

timeline.bodyText: You can move this down and just evaluate if(value == null) { value = WindowedValue.valueInGlobalWindow(null); }
timeline.author: iemejia
